intro: Cyperus teneristolon, commonly known as slender flatsedge, is a flowering plant in the sedge family, Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and wetlands. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are often wind-pollinated. It is characterized by its slender stems and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Cyperus teneristolon plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems and can sometimes be an indicator of waterlogged conditions.
